result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeramie J Shea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.
No abusive contact with Heather Shea.

Comply with all conditions of the CHIPS order. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Comply with mental health counseling and mental health medications.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeramie J Shea in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:34 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Defendant stipulates to prior convictions for repeater.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.   Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
No abusive contact with Heather Shea. 
Comply with all conditions of the CHIPS order. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Comply with mental health counseling and mental health medications. 
Pay costs including the domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge. 
No pre-trial incarceration credit. 

Defendant indicates he has submitted a DNA sample in a past felony case. 
Court advises post-conviction relief.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeramie J Shea in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:18 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 232 Prentice St N, Apt 26, Stevens Point, WI 54481-1180 United States

Prior: 1118 Park St, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Preliminary hearing on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeramie J Shea in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
 Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash previously posted. 
No contact, direct/indirect, with Heather Shea.  
Any placement time with the children must be conducted thru 3rd parties.

Defendant Jeramie J Shea in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant would like to consult with the Public Defender. 

Court questions defendant. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court re: his employment. 

BY THE COURT:  Cash bond posted is continued. 

Atty Cousins requests conditions.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
